content.text:
# List of awards and nominations received by Sabrina Carpenter

| colspan="2" width=50

|}
American singer, songwriter, and actress Sabrina Carpenter has won many accolades and awards throughout her career. Including multiple iHeartRadio Music Awards, Radio Disney Music Awards, and Kids’ Choice Awards, as well as nominations for MTV Video Music Awards, Billboard Music Awards, and Teen Choice Awards. As of 2025, Carpenter has won 26 awards from 58 nominations across music, film, and television. She became the first Grammy winner from the Lehigh Valley region of Pennsylvania to win a performance Grammy. She was also included in the 2024 TIME100 Next list, which recognizes rising stars across industries.
Carpenter began her career as a child actress and rose to prominence with her role as Maya Hart in the Disney Channel series Girl Meets World (2014–2017). For her performance, she received nominations at the Teen Choice Awards and Kids’ Choice Awards, while also being recognized for her vocal work on the show’s soundtrack. She later starred in the Disney Channel Original Movie Adventures in Babysitting (2016), which earned her additional fan-voted award nominations.
In January 2015, Carpenter released "We'll Be the Stars". which served as the lead single for her debut studio album Eyes Wide Open, which was released on April 14, 2015, and peaked at number 43 on the  Billboard 200. In July 2017, Carpenter released the single "Why", which received positive reviews, and peaked at number 21 on the Billboard Bubbling Under Hot 100. It was nominated for a Radio Disney Music Award.
As a recording artist, Carpenter signed with Hollywood Records and released her debut EP Can’t Blame a Girl for Trying (2014). The title track won a Radio Disney Music Award for Best Crush Song. Her subsequent albums, including Eyes Wide Open (2015), Evolution (2016), and Singular: Act I (2018), brought her further recognition at Radio Disney and teen-oriented ceremonies.
Carpenter achieved her mainstream music breakthrough with the release of her fifth studio album Emails i can’t send (2022), which produced the viral single "Nonsense." The song won TikTok Bop of the Year at the 2024 iHeartRadio Music Awards. In 2024, her single "Espresso" became an international hit, earning nominations at the MTV Video Music Awards for Best Song of the Summer and Best New Artist, as well as at the Billboard Music Awards.
Sabrina Carpenter has won 2 Grammy Awards, 4 Nickelodeon Kids’ Choice Awards, 2 iHeartRadio Music Awards, and multiple Radio Disney Music Awards.
